comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Charles Charters was a "prominent Christian Scientist" in New York City -- and in 1912, took legal action against another man for alienation of his wife's affection. NYT May 12, 1912, Sunday. CHARTERS SUES FOR $100,000; Christian Scientist Says Temple Alienated Wife's Affections.[ query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D07EFDC103AE633A... ] The book in his hand has a cross and crown symbol used by Christian Scientists according to www.seiyaku.com/customs/crosses/crown.html . So this is probably the same guy.
